strategy_reasoning: Gamifying the OpenClaw integration as a 'New Item Acquired' moment in a retro RPG makes technical setup updates feel rewarding and accessible rather than dry and complicated.
visual_style: Cozy 8-bit pixel art, Stardew Valley meets Zelda item screens, chunky sprites, warm CRT glow, mandatory lime green (#ecf874) accents.

images.prompt: Retro RPG 'Item Acquired' screen. Center stage is a cute pixel art bee mascot (round yellow body, brown stripes, pink blush, small wings) hovering excitedly next to a floating, glowing mechanical claw icon. The claw is stylized and friendly. Background is a soft lime green (#ecf874) sunburst pattern on warm cream. Chunky 8-bit pixels, magical sparkles, warm lighting. Text in pixel font: 'OPENCLAW JOINED'. Nostalgic, celebratory vibe.
images.description: The Bee unlocking OpenClaw as a new party member/tool.

images.prompt: Isometric pixel art garden scene. The cute bee mascot is relaxing on a picnic blanket while the pixelated OpenClaw (friendly robot arm) automatically waters and plants neon lime green (#ecf874) digital flowers. Represents 'auto-install' and 'auto-onboard'. Soft pastel mint and peach gradient sky. Cozy Stardew Valley aesthetic. A small retro dialogue box says 'Setup: 100%'. Peaceful, automated, helpful.
images.description: Visualizing the auto-install/onboard feature as an automated gardening helper.

images.prompt: Close-up cozy portrait of the bee mascot and the OpenClaw high-fiving (or fist-bumping). The Claw looks shiny and polished with new branding colors (lime green #ecf874 and dark purple #110518). Background is a dreamy lavender to cream gradient with floating pixel hearts. Warm sunset lighting, scanlines, lo-fi chill beats vibe. Text: 'LET'S BUILD'. Wholesome and team-oriented.
images.description: Celebrating the polished branding and readiness to build.
